item.title: March Is 10th Straight Month To Be Hottest On Record
item.description: The European climate agency says Earth was record hot for the 10th consecutive month in March.
item.content:encoded: The European climate agency says Earth was record hot for the 10th consecutive month in March.

item.title: Cambodia Investigates YouTubers Over Abuse Of Monkeys At Angkor UNESCO Site
item.description: Authorities say it is a growing problem as people look for new ways to draw online viewers to generate cash.
item.content:encoded: Authorities say it is a growing problem as people look for new ways to draw online viewers to generate cash.

item.title: Palestinians Returning To Khan Younis After Israeli Withdrawal Find Unrecognizable City
item.description: Stunned Palestinians in Gaza’s Khan Younis are finding their home city unrecognizable as they filter in to salvage what they can from the vast destruction left by Israeli troops.
item.content:encoded: Stunned Palestinians in Gaza’s Khan Younis are finding their home city unrecognizable as they filter in to salvage what they can from the vast destruction left by Israeli troops.

item.title: Vatican Blasts Gender-Affirming Surgery, Surrogacy As Violations Of Human Dignity
item.description: In a document called "Infinite Dignity," the Vatican also repeated its rejection of "gender theory."
item.content:encoded: In a document called "Infinite Dignity," the Vatican also repeated its rejection of "gender theory."

item.title: Crusading Brazil Supreme Court Justice Orders Investigation Of Elon Musk
item.description: A Brazilian Supreme Court justice is adding Elon Musk to an investigation over the dissemination of fake news and is investigating him for alleged obstruction.
item.content:encoded: A Brazilian Supreme Court justice is adding Elon Musk to an investigation over the dissemination of fake news and is investigating him for alleged obstruction.

item.title: Rwandan President Blames World's Inaction On Anniversary Of 1994 Genocide
item.description: Rwandan authorities have long blamed the international community for allowing extremists to kill an estimated 800,000 people 30 years ago.
item.content:encoded: Rwandan authorities have long blamed the international community for allowing extremists to kill an estimated 800,000 people 30 years ago.

item.title: Six Months Into The Israel-Hamas War, Here's A Look At Gaza's Destruction By The Numbers
item.description: The offensive in the Palestinian enclave has stretched on for half a year, becoming one of the most destructive and deadly conflicts of the 21st century.
item.content:encoded: The offensive in the Palestinian enclave has stretched on for half a year, becoming one of the most destructive and deadly conflicts of the 21st century.

item.title: Israeli Military Announces Withdrawal From Khan Younis As Troops Look To Rafah
item.description: Six months after Israel began its offensive, Palestinians return to the southern Gaza city that's been completely destroyed.
item.content:encoded: Six months after Israel began its offensive, Palestinians return to the southern Gaza city that's been completely destroyed.

item.title: Mexico Severs Diplomatic Ties With Ecuador After Police Storm Its Embassy To Arrest Politician
item.description: Police broke into the Mexican Embassy to arrest a former Ecuadorian vice president who had sought political asylum.
item.content:encoded: Police broke into the Mexican Embassy to arrest a former Ecuadorian vice president who had sought political asylum.
